info.title: PayPal Payments v2
info.description: Call the Payments API to authorize payments, capture authorized payments, refund payments that have already been captured, and show payment information. Use the Payments API in conjunction with the Orders API.

get.description: Shows details for an authorized payment, by ID.

parameters.name: authorization_id
parameters.description: The ID of the authorized payment for which to show details.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body that shows authorization details.

schema.description: The authorized payment transaction.

update_time.description: The date and time when the transaction was last updated, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

expiration_time.description: The date and time when the authorized payment expires, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

create_time.description: The date and time when the transaction occurred, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

seller_protection.description: The level of protection offered as defined by [PayPal Seller Protection for Merchants](https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/security/seller-protection).

status.description: Indicates whether the transaction is eligible for seller protection. For information, see [PayPal Seller Protection for Merchants](https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/security/seller-protection).

x-enum.description: Your PayPal balance remains intact if the customer claims that he or she did not receive an item or the account holder claims that he or she did not authorize the payment.
Your PayPal balance remains intact if the customer claims that he or she did not receive an item.
This transaction is not eligible for seller protection.

dispute_categories.description: An array of conditions that are covered for the transaction.

items.description: The condition that is covered for the transaction.

x-enum.description: The payer paid for an item that he or she did not receive.
The payer did not authorize the payment.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the authorized payment.

amount.description: The amount for this authorized payment.

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

status.description: The status for the authorized payment.

x-enum.description: The authorized payment is created. No captured payments have been made for this authorized payment.
The authorized payment has one or more captures against it. The sum of these captured payments is greater than the amount of the original authorized payment.
PayPal cannot authorize funds for this authorized payment.
The authorized payment has expired.
A captured payment was made for the authorized payment for an amount that is less than the amount of the original authorized payment.
The authorized payment was voided. No more captured payments can be made against this authorized payment.

500.description: The request failed because an internal server error occurred.

post.description: Captures an authorized payment, by ID.

parameters.name: authorization_id
parameters.description: The ID of the authorized payment for which to show details.

parameters.name: PayPal-Request-Id
parameters.description: The server stores keys for 45 days.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description:
The preferred server response upon successful completion of the request. Value is:
  • return=minimal. The server returns a minimal response to optimize communication between the API caller and the server. A minimal response includes the id, status and HATEOAS links.
  • return=representation. The server returns a complete resource representation, including the current state of the resource.

schema.description: Captures either a portion or the full authorized amount of an authorized payment.

payment_instruction.description: Any additional payment instructions for PayPal for Partner customers. Enables features for partners and marketplaces, such as delayed disbursement and collection of a platform fee. Applies during order creation for captured payments or during capture of authorized payments.

platform_fees.description: An array of various fees, commissions, tips, or donations.

items.description: The platform or partner fee, commission, or brokerage fee that is associated with the transaction. Not a separate or isolated transaction leg from the external perspective. The platform fee is limited in scope and is always associated with the original payment for the purchase unit.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

payee.description: The recipient of the fee for this transaction. If you omit this value, the default is the API caller.

merchant_id.description: The encrypted PayPal account ID of the merchant.

client_id.description: The public identifier for app created by the merchant/payee. Introduced to support use cases (for e.g. BrainTree integration with PayPal) where payee email_address or merchant_id is not available.

disbursement_mode.description: The funds that are held on behalf of the merchant.

x-enum.description: The funds are released to the merchant immediately.

The funds are held for a finite number of days. The actual duration depends on the region and type of integration. You can release the funds through a referenced payout. Otherwise, the funds disbursed automatically after the specified duration.

final_capture.description: Indicates whether you can make additional captures against the authorized payment. Set to `true` if you do not intend to capture additional payments against the authorization. Set to `false` if you intend to capture additional payments against the authorization.

amount.description: The amount to capture. To capture a portion of the full authorized amount, specify an amount. If amount is not specified, the full authorized amount is captured. The amount must be a positive number and in the same currency as the authorization against which the payment is being captured.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

201.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 201 Created status code and a JSON response body that shows captured payment details.

schema.description: A captured payment.

disbursement_mode.description: The funds that are held on behalf of the merchant.

update_time.description: The date and time when the transaction was last updated, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

create_time.description: The date and time when the transaction occurred, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

seller_protection.description: The level of protection offered as defined by [PayPal Seller Protection for Merchants](https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/security/seller-protection).

dispute_categories.description: An array of conditions that are covered for the transaction.

items.description: The condition that is covered for the transaction.

x-enum.description: The payer paid for an item that he or she did not receive.
The payer did not authorize the payment.

status.description: Indicates whether the transaction is eligible for seller protection. For information, see [PayPal Seller Protection for Merchants](https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/security/seller-protection).

x-enum.description: Your PayPal balance remains intact if the customer claims that he or she did not receive an item or the account holder claims that he or she did not authorize the payment.
Your PayPal balance remains intact if the customer claims that he or she did not receive an item.
This transaction is not eligible for seller protection.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the captured payment.

seller_receivable_breakdown.description: The detailed breakdown of the captured payment.

gross_amount.description: The amount for this captured payment.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

paypal_fee.description: The applicable fee for this captured payment.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

net_amount.description: The net amount that the payee receives for this captured payment in their PayPal account. The net amount is computed as gross_amount minus the paypal_fee minus the platform_fees.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

receivable_amount.description: The net amount that is credited to the payee's PayPal account. Returned only when the currency of the captured payment is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the payee wants to credit the funds. The amount is computed as net_amount times exchange_rate.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate that determines the amount that is credited to the payee's PayPal account. Returned when the currency of the captured payment is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the payee wants to credit the funds.

source_currency.description: The source currency from which to convert an amount.

target_currency.description: The target currency into which to convert an amount.

value.description: The target currency amount. Equivalent to one unit of the source currency. Formatted as integer or decimal value with one to 15 digits to the right of the decimal point.

platform_fees.description: An array of platform or partner fees, commissions, or brokerage fees that associated with the captured payment.

items.description: The platform or partner fee, commission, or brokerage fee that is associated with the transaction. Not a separate or isolated transaction leg from the external perspective. The platform fee is limited in scope and is always associated with the original payment for the purchase unit.

payee.description: The recipient of the fee for this transaction. If you omit this value, the default is the API caller.

merchant_id.description: The encrypted PayPal account ID of the merchant.

client_id.description: The public identifier for app created by the merchant/payee. Introduced to support use cases (for e.g. BrainTree integration with PayPal) where payee email_address or merchant_id is not available.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

amount.description: The amount for this captured payment.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

final_capture.description: Indicates whether you can make additional captures against the authorized payment. Set to `true` if you do not intend to capture additional payments against the authorization. Set to `false` if you intend to capture additional payments against the authorization.

status_details.description: The details of the captured payment status.

reason.description: The reason why the captured payment status is `PENDING` or `DENIED`.

x-enum.description: The payer initiated a dispute for this captured payment with PayPal.
The captured funds were reversed in response to the payer disputing this captured payment with the issuer of the financial instrument used to pay for this captured payment.
The payer paid by an eCheck that has not yet cleared.
Visit your online account. In your **Account Overview**, accept and deny this payment.
No additional specific reason can be provided. For more information about this captured payment, visit your account online or contact PayPal.
The captured payment is pending manual review.

The payee has not yet set up appropriate receiving preferences for their account. For more information about how to accept or deny this payment, visit your account online. This reason is typically offered in scenarios such as when the currency of the captured payment is different from the primary holding currency of the payee.
The captured funds were refunded.
The payer must send the funds for this captured payment. This code generally appears for manual EFTs.
The payee does not have a PayPal account.
The payee's PayPal account is not verified.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

500.description: The request failed because an internal server error occurred.

post.description:
Reauthorizes an authorized PayPal account payment, by ID. To ensure that funds are still available, reauthorize a payment after its initial three-day honor period expires. You can reauthorize a payment only once from days four to 29.

If 30 days have transpired since the date of the original authorization, you must create an authorized payment instead of reauthorizing the original authorized payment.

A reauthorized payment itself has a new honor period of three days.

You can reauthorize an authorized payment once for up to 115% of the original authorized amount, not to exceed an increase of $75 USD.

Supports only the `amount` request parameter.
Note: This request is currently not supported for Partner usecases.

parameters.name: authorization_id
parameters.description: The ID of the authorized payment for which to show details.

parameters.name: PayPal-Request-Id
parameters.description: The server stores keys for 45 days.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description:
The preferred server response upon successful completion of the request. Value is:
  • return=minimal. The server returns a minimal response to optimize communication between the API caller and the server. A minimal response includes the id, status and HATEOAS links.
  • return=representation. The server returns a complete resource representation, including the current state of the resource.

schema.description:
Reauthorizes an authorized PayPal account payment, by ID. To ensure that funds are still available, reauthorize a payment after its initial three-day honor period expires. You can reauthorize a payment only once from days four to 29.

If 30 days have transpired since the date of the original authorization, you must create an authorized payment instead of reauthorizing the original authorized payment.

A reauthorized payment itself has a new honor period of three days.

You can reauthorize an authorized payment once for up to 115% of the original authorized amount, not to exceed an increase of $75 USD.

Supports only the `amount` request parameter.
Note: This request is currently not supported for Partner usecases.

amount.description: The amount to reauthorize for an authorized payment.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

201.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 201 Created status code and a JSON response body that shows the reauthorized payment details.

schema.description: The authorized payment transaction.

update_time.description: The date and time when the transaction was last updated, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

expiration_time.description: The date and time when the authorized payment expires, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

create_time.description: The date and time when the transaction occurred, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

seller_protection.description: The level of protection offered as defined by [PayPal Seller Protection for Merchants](https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/security/seller-protection).

status.description: Indicates whether the transaction is eligible for seller protection. For information, see [PayPal Seller Protection for Merchants](https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/security/seller-protection).

x-enum.description: Your PayPal balance remains intact if the customer claims that he or she did not receive an item or the account holder claims that he or she did not authorize the payment.
Your PayPal balance remains intact if the customer claims that he or she did not receive an item.
This transaction is not eligible for seller protection.

dispute_categories.description: An array of conditions that are covered for the transaction.

items.description: The condition that is covered for the transaction.

x-enum.description: The payer paid for an item that he or she did not receive.
The payer did not authorize the payment.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the authorized payment.

amount.description: The amount for this authorized payment.

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

status.description: The status for the authorized payment.

x-enum.description: The authorized payment is created. No captured payments have been made for this authorized payment.
The authorized payment has one or more captures against it. The sum of these captured payments is greater than the amount of the original authorized payment.
PayPal cannot authorize funds for this authorized payment.
The authorized payment has expired.
A captured payment was made for the authorized payment for an amount that is less than the amount of the original authorized payment.
The authorized payment was voided. No more captured payments can be made against this authorized payment.

500.description: The request failed because an internal server error occurred.

get.description: Shows details for a captured payment, by ID.

parameters.name: capture_id
parameters.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the captured payment for which to show details.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body that shows captured payment details.

schema.description: A captured payment.

disbursement_mode.description: The funds that are held on behalf of the merchant.

update_time.description: The date and time when the transaction was last updated, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

create_time.description: The date and time when the transaction occurred, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

seller_protection.description: The level of protection offered as defined by [PayPal Seller Protection for Merchants](https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/security/seller-protection).

dispute_categories.description: An array of conditions that are covered for the transaction.

items.description: The condition that is covered for the transaction.

x-enum.description: The payer paid for an item that he or she did not receive.
The payer did not authorize the payment.

status.description: Indicates whether the transaction is eligible for seller protection. For information, see [PayPal Seller Protection for Merchants](https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/security/seller-protection).

x-enum.description: Your PayPal balance remains intact if the customer claims that he or she did not receive an item or the account holder claims that he or she did not authorize the payment.
Your PayPal balance remains intact if the customer claims that he or she did not receive an item.
This transaction is not eligible for seller protection.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the captured payment.

seller_receivable_breakdown.description: The detailed breakdown of the captured payment.

gross_amount.description: The amount for this captured payment.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

paypal_fee.description: The applicable fee for this captured payment.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

net_amount.description: The net amount that the payee receives for this captured payment in their PayPal account. The net amount is computed as gross_amount minus the paypal_fee minus the platform_fees.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

receivable_amount.description: The net amount that is credited to the payee's PayPal account. Returned only when the currency of the captured payment is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the payee wants to credit the funds. The amount is computed as net_amount times exchange_rate.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate that determines the amount that is credited to the payee's PayPal account. Returned when the currency of the captured payment is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the payee wants to credit the funds.

source_currency.description: The source currency from which to convert an amount.

target_currency.description: The target currency into which to convert an amount.

value.description: The target currency amount. Equivalent to one unit of the source currency. Formatted as integer or decimal value with one to 15 digits to the right of the decimal point.

platform_fees.description: An array of platform or partner fees, commissions, or brokerage fees that associated with the captured payment.

items.description: The platform or partner fee, commission, or brokerage fee that is associated with the transaction. Not a separate or isolated transaction leg from the external perspective. The platform fee is limited in scope and is always associated with the original payment for the purchase unit.

payee.description: The recipient of the fee for this transaction. If you omit this value, the default is the API caller.

merchant_id.description: The encrypted PayPal account ID of the merchant.

client_id.description: The public identifier for app created by the merchant/payee. Introduced to support use cases (for e.g. BrainTree integration with PayPal) where payee email_address or merchant_id is not available.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

amount.description: The amount for this captured payment.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

final_capture.description: Indicates whether you can make additional captures against the authorized payment. Set to `true` if you do not intend to capture additional payments against the authorization. Set to `false` if you intend to capture additional payments against the authorization.

status_details.description: The details of the captured payment status.

reason.description: The reason why the captured payment status is `PENDING` or `DENIED`.

x-enum.description: The payer initiated a dispute for this captured payment with PayPal.
The captured funds were reversed in response to the payer disputing this captured payment with the issuer of the financial instrument used to pay for this captured payment.
The payer paid by an eCheck that has not yet cleared.
Visit your online account. In your **Account Overview**, accept and deny this payment.
No additional specific reason can be provided. For more information about this captured payment, visit your account online or contact PayPal.
The captured payment is pending manual review.

The payee has not yet set up appropriate receiving preferences for their account. For more information about how to accept or deny this payment, visit your account online. This reason is typically offered in scenarios such as when the currency of the captured payment is different from the primary holding currency of the payee.
The captured funds were refunded.
The payer must send the funds for this captured payment. This code generally appears for manual EFTs.
The payee does not have a PayPal account.
The payee's PayPal account is not verified.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

status.description: The status of the captured payment.

x-enum.description: The funds for this captured payment were credited to the payee's PayPal account.
The funds could not be captured.
An amount less than this captured payment's amount was partially refunded to the payer.
The funds for this captured payment was not yet credited to the payee's PayPal account. For more information, see status.details
An amount greater than or equal to this captured payment's amount was refunded to the payer.

500.description: The request failed because an internal server error occurred.

post.description: Refunds a captured payment, by ID. For a full refund, include an empty payload in the JSON request body. For a partial refund, include an amount object in the JSON request body.

parameters.name: capture_id
parameters.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the captured payment for which to show details.

parameters.name: PayPal-Request-Id
parameters.description: The server stores keys for 45 days.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description:
The preferred server response upon successful completion of the request. Value is:
  • return=minimal. The server returns a minimal response to optimize communication between the API caller and the server. A minimal response includes the id, status and HATEOAS links.
  • return=representation. The server returns a complete resource representation, including the current state of the resource.

schema.description: Refunds a captured payment, by ID. For a full refund, include an empty request body. For a partial refund, include an amount object in the request body.

amount.description: The amount to refund. To refund a portion of the captured amount, specify an amount. If amount is not specified, an amount equal to captured amount - previous refunds is refunded. The amount must be a positive number and in the same currency as the one in which the payment was captured.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

note_to_payer.description: The reason for the refund. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

201.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 201 Created status code and a JSON response body that shows refund details.

schema.description: The refund information.

update_time.description: The date and time when the transaction was last updated, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

create_time.description: The date and time when the transaction occurred, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the refund.

amount.description: The amount that the payee refunded to the payer.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

status_details.description: The details of the refund status.

reason.description: The reason why the refund has the `PENDING` or `FAILED` status.

x-enum.description: The customer's account is funded through an eCheck, which has not yet cleared.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

x-enum.description: The refund was cancelled.
The refund is pending. For more information, see status_details.reason.
The funds for this transaction were debited to the customer's account.

note_to_payer.description: The reason for the refund. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

gross_amount.description: The amount that the payee refunded to the payer.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

paypal_fee.description: The PayPal fee that was refunded to the payer. This fee might not match the PayPal fee that the payee paid when the payment was captured.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

net_amount.description: The net amount that the payee's account is debited, if the payee holds funds in the currency for this refund. The net amount is calculated as gross_amount minus paypal_fee minus platform_fees.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

platform_fees.description: An array of platform or partner fees, commissions, or brokerage fees for the refund.

items.description: The platform or partner fee, commission, or brokerage fee that is associated with the transaction. Not a separate or isolated transaction leg from the external perspective. The platform fee is limited in scope and is always associated with the original payment for the purchase unit.

payee.description: The recipient of the fee for this transaction. If you omit this value, the default is the API caller.

merchant_id.description: The encrypted PayPal account ID of the merchant.

client_id.description: The public identifier for app created by the merchant/payee. Introduced to support use cases (for e.g. BrainTree integration with PayPal) where payee email_address or merchant_id is not available.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

net_amount_breakdown.description: An array of breakdown values for the net amount. Returned when the currency of the refund is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the payee holds their funds.

items.description: The net amount. Returned when the currency of the refund is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the merchant holds their funds.

payable_amount.description: The net amount debited from the merchant's PayPal account.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

value.description:

  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate that determines the amount that was debited from the merchant's PayPal account.

value.description: The target currency amount. Equivalent to one unit of the source currency. Formatted as integer or decimal value with one to 15 digits to the right of the decimal point.

source_currency.description: The source currency from which to convert an amount.

target_currency.description: The target currency into which to convert an amount.

total_refunded_amount.description: The total amount refunded from the original capture to date. For example, if a payer makes a $100 purchase and was refunded $20 a week ago and was refunded $30 in this refund, the `gross_amount` is $30 for this refund and the `total_refunded_amount` is $50.

value.description:

500.description: The request failed because an internal server error occurred.

get.description: Shows details for a refund, by ID.

parameters.name: refund_id
parameters.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the refund for which to show details.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body that shows refund details.

schema.description: The refund information.

update_time.description: The date and time when the transaction was last updated, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

create_time.description: The date and time when the transaction occurred, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the refund.

amount.description: The amount that the payee refunded to the payer.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

status_details.description: The details of the refund status.

reason.description: The reason why the refund has the `PENDING` or `FAILED` status.

x-enum.description: The customer's account is funded through an eCheck, which has not yet cleared.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

x-enum.description: The refund was cancelled.
The refund is pending. For more information, see status_details.reason.
The funds for this transaction were debited to the customer's account.

note_to_payer.description: The reason for the refund. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

gross_amount.description: The amount that the payee refunded to the payer.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

paypal_fee.description: The PayPal fee that was refunded to the payer. This fee might not match the PayPal fee that the payee paid when the payment was captured.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

net_amount.description: The net amount that the payee's account is debited, if the payee holds funds in the currency for this refund. The net amount is calculated as gross_amount minus paypal_fee minus platform_fees.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

platform_fees.description: An array of platform or partner fees, commissions, or brokerage fees for the refund.

items.description: The platform or partner fee, commission, or brokerage fee that is associated with the transaction. Not a separate or isolated transaction leg from the external perspective. The platform fee is limited in scope and is always associated with the original payment for the purchase unit.

payee.description: The recipient of the fee for this transaction. If you omit this value, the default is the API caller.

merchant_id.description: The encrypted PayPal account ID of the merchant.

client_id.description: The public identifier for app created by the merchant/payee. Introduced to support use cases (for e.g. BrainTree integration with PayPal) where payee email_address or merchant_id is not available.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

net_amount_breakdown.description: An array of breakdown values for the net amount. Returned when the currency of the refund is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the payee holds their funds.

items.description: The net amount. Returned when the currency of the refund is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the merchant holds their funds.

payable_amount.description: The net amount debited from the merchant's PayPal account.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate that determines the amount that was debited from the merchant's PayPal account.

value.description: The target currency amount. Equivalent to one unit of the source currency. Formatted as integer or decimal value with one to 15 digits to the right of the decimal point.

source_currency.description: The source currency from which to convert an amount.

target_currency.description: The target currency into which to convert an amount.

total_refunded_amount.description: The total amount refunded from the original capture to date. For example, if a payer makes a $100 purchase and was refunded $20 a week ago and was refunded $30 in this refund, the `gross_amount` is $30 for this refund and the `total_refunded_amount` is $50.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

x-oas-tags-definition.name: authorizations
x-oas-tags-definition.description: Use the `/authorizations` resource to show details for, capture payment for, reauthorize, and void authorized payments.

x-oas-tags-definition.name: captures
x-oas-tags-definition.description: Use the `/captures` resource to show details for and refund a captured payment.

x-oas-tags-definition.name: refunds
x-oas-tags-definition.description: Use the `/refunds` resource to show refund details.

x-errors.name: ACCOUNT_CLOSED
x-errors.message: Refund failed as payer account is closed.
x-errors.description: Payments cannot be made to an account that is closed. Contact the payer to find alternate method to refund the payment.

x-errors.name: AUTHORIZATION_ALREADY_CAPTURED
x-errors.message: Authorization has already been captured.
x-errors.description: If `final_capture` is set to to `true`, additional captures are not possible against the authorization.

x-errors.name: AUTHORIZATION_DENIED
x-errors.message: A denied authorization cannot be captured.
x-errors.description: You cannot capture a denied authorization.

x-errors.name: AUTHORIZATION_EXPIRED
x-errors.message: The authorization has expired.
x-errors.description: You cannot capture an expired authorization.

x-errors.name: AUTHORIZATION_VOIDED
x-errors.message: The authorization is voided.
x-errors.description: You cannot capture a voided authorization.

x-errors.name: CANNOT_BE_NEGATIVE_OR_ZERO
x-errors.message: The value of the field should be greater than zero.
x-errors.description: Specify a different value and try the request again.

x-errors.name: CAPTURE_FULLY_REFUNDED
x-errors.message: The capture has already been fully refunded.
x-errors.description: You cannot capture additional refunds against this capture.

x-errors.name: CURRENCY_MISMATCH_REFUND
x-errors.message: Refund must be in the same currency as the capture.
x-errors.description: Verify the currency of the refund and try the request again.

x-errors.name: DECIMAL_PRECISION_EXCEEDED
x-errors.message: The value of the field should not be more than two decimal places.
x-errors.description: Verify the number of decimals places and try the request again.

x-errors.name: DECIMALS_NOT_SUPPORTED
x-errors.message: Currency does not support decimals.
x-errors.description: For more information, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

x-errors.name: DUPLICATE_INVOICE_ID
x-errors.message: Requested invoice number has been previously captured.
x-errors.description: Payment for this invoice was already captured.

x-errors.name: EXCEEDED_MAXIMUM_REFUND_ATTEMPTS
x-errors.message: You have exceeded the maximum number of refund attempts for this capture.
x-errors.description: To confirm the number of allowed refunds and captures for the merchant account, contact Customer Support.

x-errors.name: EXCEEDS_MAX_CAPTURE_AMOUNT
x-errors.message: Capture amount specified exceeded allowable limit.
x-errors.description: Specify a different amount and try the request again. Alternately, contact Customer Support to increase your limits.

x-errors.name: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
x-errors.message: An internal server error has occurred.
x-errors.description: Try your request again later.

x-errors.name: INVALID_CURRENCY_CODE
x-errors.message: Currency code should be a three-character ISO-4217 currency code.
x-errors.description: For the list of valid currency codes, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

x-errors.name: INVALID_PARAMETER_SYNTAX
x-errors.message: The value of the field does not conform to the expected format.
x-errors.description: Verify the specification for supported `pattern` and try the request again.

x-errors.name: INVALID_PAYEE_ACCOUNT
x-errors.message: Payee account is invalid.
x-errors.description: Verify the payee account information and try the request again.

x-errors.name: INVALID_PLATFORM_FEES_AMOUNT
x-errors.message: The `platform_fees` amount cannot be greater than the capture amount.
x-errors.description: Verify the `platform_fees` amount and try the request again.

x-errors.name: INVALID_RESOURCE_ID
x-errors.message: Specified resource ID does not exist.
x-errors.description: Verify the resource ID and try the request again.

x-errors.name: INVALID_STRING_LENGTH
x-errors.message: The value of a field is either too short or too long.
x-errors.description: Verify the specification for the supported `min` and `max` values and try the request again.

x-errors.name: MAX_CAPTURE_EXCEEDED
x-errors.message: Maximum number of allowable captures has been reached.
x-errors.description: You cannot make additional captures.

x-errors.name: MISSING_REQUIRED_PARAMETER
x-errors.message: A required field or parameter is missing.
x-errors.description: Verify the specification for `required` fields and try the request again.

x-errors.name: NOT_AUTHORIZED
x-errors.message: You do not have permission to access or perform operations on this resource.
x-errors.description: To make API calls on behalf of a merchant, ensure that you have sufficient permissions to proceed with this transaction.

x-errors.name: PARTIAL_REFUND_NOT_ALLOWED
x-errors.message: You cannot do a refund for an amount less than the original capture amount.
x-errors.description: Specify an amount equal to the capture amount or omit the `amount` object from the request. Then, try the request again.

x-errors.name: PAYEE_ACCOUNT_LOCKED_OR_CLOSED
x-errors.message: Payee account locked or closed.
x-errors.description: To get more information about the status of the account, call Customer Support.

x-errors.name: PAYEE_ACCOUNT_RESTRICTED
x-errors.message: Payee account is restricted.
x-errors.description: To get more information about the status of the account, call Customer Support.

x-errors.name: PAYER_CANNOT_PAY
x-errors.message: The combination of payer and payee settings prevent this payer from paying this payee, or merchant.
x-errors.description: Verify that the merchant account does not define rules that automatically decline payments from certain types of payers.

x-errors.name: PENDING_CAPTURE
x-errors.message: Cannot initiate a refund as the capture is pending.
x-errors.description: Capture is typically pending when the payer has funded the transaction by using an e-check or bank account.

x-errors.name: PERMISSION_DENIED
x-errors.message: You do not have permission to access or perform operations on this resource.
x-errors.description: To make API calls on behalf of a merchant, ensure that you have sufficient permissions to proceed with this transaction.

x-errors.name: PERMISSION_NOT_GRANTED
x-errors.message: Payee of the authorization has not granted permission to perform capture on the authorization.
x-errors.description: To make API calls on behalf of a merchant, ensure that you have sufficient permissions to capture the authorization.

x-errors.name: REFUND_AMOUNT_EXCEEDED
x-errors.message: The refund amount must be less than or equal to the capture amount that has not yet been refunded.
x-errors.description: Verify the refund amount and try the request again.

x-errors.name: REFUND_FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
x-errors.message: Capture could not be refunded due to insufficient funds.
x-errors.description: Verify that either you have sufficient funds in your PayPal account or the bank account that is linked to your PayPal account is verified and has sufficient funds.

x-errors.name: REFUND_ISSUED
x-errors.message: Refund was already issued for capture.
x-errors.description: You cannot make additional refunds against this capture.

x-errors.name: REFUND_TIME_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
x-errors.message: You are over the time limit to perform a refund on this capture.
x-errors.description: The refund cannot be issued at this time.

x-errors.name: TRANSACTION_ALREADY_REFUNDED
x-errors.message: The capture was already refunded.
x-errors.description: You cannot make additional refunds against this capture.

x-errors.name: TRANSACTION_REFUSED
x-errors.message: PayPal's internal controls prevent authorization from being captured.
x-errors.description: For more information about this transaction, contact customer support.

x-errors.name: AUTHENTICATION_FAILURE
x-errors.message: Authentication failed due to missing authorization header, or invalid authentication credentials.
x-errors.description: Account validations failed for the user.

x-requestValidationIssues.details: Specify an alphanumeric value.

x-requestValidationIssues.name: InvalidAlphanumericSpaceHyphen

x-requestValidationIssues.details: Ensure all characters in the field, such as the name, are valid.

x-requestValidationIssues.details: Provide an acceptable card type and resend the request.
